title: Is social media dead?
intro: What is your favourite social media platform? Do you still use it as much as you did three or four years ago? With the rise of generative AI, many social media users are finding their feeds cluttered with content that they feel no real connection with. Is social media on a downward spiral? Neil and Pippa discuss this and teach you some new vocabulary.
this_week_question: The first electronic message was sent in 1844, using a series of dots and dashes tapped out by hand on a telegraph wire. What was this new form of communication called?
a) semaphore b) dial-up c) Morse code
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

vocab.desc: (informal) spoken exclamation used to show excitement or enthusiasm shatter an illusion destroy someone's false belief or misconception, causing them to realise the unpleasant truth cultural happening event that embodies the interests and values of a particular cultural group at a particular time in history behemoth extremely large and powerful company or organisation novelty something which is new and unusual and therefore exciting gravitate towards (something or someone) be naturally drawn or attracted to something or someone
